<div class="hero">
  <div class="hero-text">
    <h1>Saifuddin Syed</h1>
    <p class="hero-role">Assistant Professor &nbsp;·&nbsp; UBC Statistics</p>
    <div class="hero-bio">
      <p>
        I am an Assistant Professor in the
        <a href="https://www.stat.ubc.ca/">Department of Statistics</a>
        at the University of British Columbia, and an inaugural member of the
        <a href="https://caida.ubc.ca/aim-si">AI Methods for Scientific Impact (AIM-SI)</a>
        cluster within <a href="https://caida.ubc.ca/">CAIDA</a>.
      </p>
      <p>
        My research focuses on the design and analysis of <strong>annealing algorithms</strong>
        for scalable Bayesian inference and generative AI. I collaborate with scientists across
        astronomy, chemistry, and biotechnology, and am a member of the Algorithms and Inference
        Working Group for the
        <a href="https://www.ngeht.org/">Next Generation Event Horizon Telescope (ngEHT)</a>.
      </p>
      <p>
        Previously, I was a Florence Nightingale Bicentenary Fellow at Oxford's Department of
        Statistics, and completed a postdoc under
        <a href="https://www.stats.ox.ac.uk/~doucet/">Arnaud Doucet</a>
        and a PhD under
        <a href="https://www.stat.ubc.ca/~bouchard/">Alexandre Bouchard-Côté</a>.
      </p>
    </div>
